comments:
I20040413

Have > 50 CVS shared projects distributed over 3 repositories (one of which
currently cannot be reached). Synchronize your workspace ==> you get a CVS error
dialog without *any* useful information (see picture). Go to the log: it simply
tells you what failed.

Were the other projects synchronized? No idea.

Expected behavior:
1. it synchronizes all projects that can be synchronized (maybe this is done
already, but I have no clue)
2. at the end report: "Synchronization done except for:" + list with top-level
containers that failed.

Here's the .log:

Good news: it does continue and synchronize all repos it can reach. 
Bad news: the error reported doesn't let you know that this is what happened.

This is an interesting, case and I would argue that this is less of an error
case then an information. If the background job returned an info status then we
could show a warning instead of throwing an exception.

That would be good. To me this often happens, e.g. when working from home but
didn't startup VPN.
Yeah, it happens for me from home too. But I've been too lazy to fix it yet :)

In addition, the error dialog has been improved. It is now more obvious that 
you can get details for an error/warning. Selecting an error and 
pressing "Show..." will show you the details of the status (the option is no 
longer hidden in the table's context menu)

Other improvements are possible to show these errors. Dani pls give it try.

The error logging is now better but we can make the workflow better. See
duplicate bug.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64358 ***
